title: To Be Witnessed
excerpt: We are obsessed with being watched, but we are starving to be witnessed. The difference is the difference between a performance and a life.

title: The Invisible Architect
excerpt: We are no longer just citizens; we are subjects in a global behavioral experiment. How the soft science of nudging became the hard infrastructure of our lives.

title: The Speed of Thought
excerpt: What happens when the barrier between having an idea and building it disappears? A reflection on using Google's Antigravity.

title: The Breaking Change
excerpt: We treat people like APIs—expecting stable endpoints and clean documentation. But the value of a human lies in their refusal to be optimized.

title: Escaping the Simulation of Self
excerpt: The algorithm makes you the protagonist of a universe curated for your retention. Other people are the only reality check left.

title: The Rise of the Non-Musician
excerpt: For centuries, music required dexterity. Now, it only requires taste. We are entering the golden age of the non-musician.

title: The New Builders Are 16
excerpt: Teenagers aren't just using Google's Antigravity to cheat on homework. They're building products that feel like magic, and they're doing it for fun.

title: The Weight of Iteration
excerpt: A look behind the curtain at the recent technical overhaul and what this studio project holds for the future.

title: The Extinction of the Modern Man
excerpt: Behavioral sciences suggest a radical shift in male archetypes is underway. Are we witnessing an end, or a transformation?

title: The Engine and The Gallery
excerpt: Why we are decoupling the signal from the noise, and how Substack powers the studio while the site preserves the art.

title: Why Most Content Feels Like 'People Are Irresponsible'
The Importance of Friendship and Conversation in the AI World
excerpt: In the era of the "Perfect Companion," the most radical act is to have a messy, real conversation.

title: Social Media is Our "First Contact"
excerpt: What happens when AI meets humanity? We're already living it—on Twitter, TikTok, and Instagram.

title: How to Scale a Coffee Shop (The Alex Hormozi Way)
excerpt: Stop selling commodities. Start selling Offers. A guide to applying the Value Equation to your local cafe.

title: There Are Richest Women—But They're Often Overshadowed
excerpt: Women make up just 13-15% of billionaires. A data-driven look at why they are less visible in the media.

title: Building This Blog with Antigravity: A Meta Reflection
excerpt: I built this entire platform in one evening with an AI coding assistant. Here's what I learned about the future

title: The Quiet Return of RSS in 2025
excerpt: In an age of algorithmic noise, the simple XML feed has become a sanctuary for intentional consumption.
